question.title: Android Accessibility Node Info Disconnected Node Error
question.body:
I have been playing around with Android's accessibility functions to try and solve a problem on a very legacy system (API 17), and everything works perfectly; however, in the logcat I get an error thrown when findAccessibilityNodeInfosByText has more than one entry returned in the list of nodes.

The error is from AccessibilityInteractionClient, and it says "3 disconnected nodes", for example, if there are 3 instances of nodes found with findAccessibilityNodeInfosByText.

Now this error is not thrown; it's only logged and doesn't affect functionality.

How to get the nodes in such a way as to not throw this error?

Where is this documented?

This is an example of the code that would throw that error if the character # appeared 3 times on screen:

for (int i = 0; i < Objects.requireNonNull(accessibilityEvent.getSource()).findAccessibilityNodeInfosByText("#").size(); i++) {
    if (accessibilityEvent.getSource().findAccessibilityNodeInfosByText("#").get(i).getText().toString().startsWith("#")) {
        // Do stuff
    }
}

question_comments.body: The message is exactly as described here: 'The error is from AccessibilityInteractionClient and it says "3 disconnected nodes"'  I have added a screenshot for more clarity
I think its pretty clear as it is to be honest
